translated: Verses of the Elder Nuns .
The Group of Twenty
The Elder Nun Ambapālī’s Verses
Black, like the color of a bee,
my eyebrows were arched.
But now, through aging, they’re like a hemp thread.
The words of the one of right is not otherwise.
Like a fragrant box,
my head was filled with flowers.
But now, through aging, it smells of body hair.
The words of the one of right is not otherwise.
Like a forest, well-planted with trees,
adorned with the best of clothes and jewelry,
but now, through aging, it’s sparse here and there.
The words of the one of right is not otherwise.🔽Adorned with gold on the shoulders,
shining with a braid of hair,
but now, through aging, my head is disheveled.
The words of the one of right is not otherwise.
Like a painting well-drawn by an artist,
my cheeks were beautiful in the past.
But now, through aging, they’re wrinkled with lines.
The words of the one of right is not otherwise.

analyzed: bhassarā su rucirā yathā maṇī 🔽nettahesum abhinīlam āyatā
translated: Shining and lovely like a gem,🔽my eyes were long and dark blue.
They do not shine when overcome by old age,
The words of the truthful one are not otherwise.

original: Saṇhatuṅgasadisī ca nāsikā,🔽Sobhate su abhiyobbanaṁ pati;
analyzed: saṇha tuṅga sadisī ca nāsikā  sobhate su abhiyobbanam pati
translated: And the nose, like the top of a well-rounded (drum),🔽Shines well on a young man;
It is as if it were covered with wrinkles by old age,
The words of the truthful one are not otherwise.
Like a well-made, well-finished bracelet,
My earlobes shine well;
They are as if pulled down by wrinkles by old age,
The words of the truthful one are not otherwise.
Like the color of a blue lotus flower,
My teeth shine well in the past;
They are as if broken and black by old age,
The words of the truthful one are not otherwise.
Wandering in the forest, in the jungle,
Cooing sweetly like a cuckoo,
It is as if it were broken here and there by old age,
The words of the truthful one are not otherwise.
Like a well-oiled, well-polished (drum),
My neck shines well in the past;
It is as if it were broken and bent by old age,
The words of the truthful one are not otherwise.
Like the trunk of a banyan tree, my two arms,
Shone well on me in the past;
They are wrinkled with age, just like a pāṭali flower,
The words of the truthful one are not otherwise.
My hands were once adorned with fine gold rings,
They shone so beautifully for me;
They are now wrinkled like roots,

analyzed: sacca vādi vacanam anaññathā  pīna vaṭṭa sahi tuk gatāḥ ubhaḥ
translated: The words of the truthful one are not otherwise.🔽My breasts were once full, round, and high,
They shone so beautifully for me;
They now hang down like gourds,

analyzed: sacca vādi vacanam anaññathā  kañcanassa phalakava sammaṭṭha
translated: The words of the truthful one are not otherwise.🔽My body was once smooth like a polished gold plate,
It shone so beautifully for me;
It is now covered with fine wrinkles,
The words of the truthful one are not otherwise.
My thighs were once like the coils of a nāga,
They shone so beautifully for me;
They are now like bamboo poles,
The words of the truthful one are not otherwise.
My shanks were once adorned with fine gold anklets,
They shone so beautifully for me;
They are now like sesame sticks,

original: Saccavādivacanaṁ anaññathā.🔽Tūlapuṇṇasadisopamā ubho,🔽Sobhare su pādā pure mama;
analyzed: sacca vādi vacanam anaññathā  tūla puṇṇa sadisa upamāḥ ubhaḥ  sobhare su pādā pure mama
translated: The words of the truthful one are not otherwise.🔽My feet were once like cotton balls,🔽They shone so beautifully for me;
They are now covered with wrinkles,
The words of the one who speaks truth are not otherwise.

analyzed: edisaḥ ahu ayam samussayaḥ  jajjaraḥ bahu dukkhānam ālayaḥ
translated: This is how this skeleton was,🔽Old, a heap of much suffering;
Fallen from the smear, the house of old age,
The words of the one who speaks truth are not otherwise.”🔽… the Elder Nun Ambapālī …
